intro: Leucanthemum sibiricum var. peleiolepis, commonly known as the Siberian ox-eye daisy, is a perennial herb native to the colder regions of Asia. It features showy white ray florets surrounding a central yellow disk, giving it a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in alpine or rocky habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom in cooler climates.
